intro: Sticherus × subremotus, commonly known as the hybrid sticherus, is a rare and intriguing botanical species that results from the cross between two distinct sticherus species. It is characterized by its unique morphological traits, which often exhibit a blend of features from its parent plants. This hybrid typically grows in moist, shaded environments, favoring rich, organic soil conditions. Its foliage is dense and often displays a striking coloration, making it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to its limited distribution and genetic complexity, it remains a topic of ongoing research in plant taxonomy and ecology.
